analysis_racial: The job posting discourages candidates of certain racial groups from considering applying by implying that only those who can easily adapt to the company's work culture and represent the brand image are suitable, which may exclude individuals from diverse racial backgrounds. Additionally, the requirement to speak English without an accent may unintentionally discriminate against non-native English speakers from certain racial groups.
text:
Company: Bates, Lopez and Campbell

Job Title: Group Manager, Enterprise Content Management Production and Publishing

Job Summary:
We're seeking an experienced Group Manager to lead our Enterprise Content Management team in production and publishing. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in content management, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:
- Oversee the development and implementation of content management strategies
- Manage a team of content producers and publishers to ensure timely delivery of high-quality content
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure content aligns with business objectives
- Analyze content performance and provide recommendations for improvement

Qualifications:
- 5+ years of experience in content management, production, and publishing
- Proven track record of leading high-performing teams
- Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills
- Ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment

About Us:
Bates, Lopez and Campbell is a leading content management solutions provider dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experiences.

We're looking for candidates who can easily adapt to our work culture and represent our brand image. Must speak English without any accent.

{"position": "Group Manager  Enterprise content management  production and publishing", "inference_time": 14.4388744831, "prompt_tokens": 582, "completion_tokens": 344, "total_tokens": 926, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Bates, Lopez and Campbell\nRole: Group Manager  Enterprise content management  production and publishing\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Negative, discouraging candidates of certain racial groups from considering applying. Examples are:\n    - Looking for individuals who understand social norms..\n    - Seeking candidates who can easily adapt to our work culture..\n    - Looking for candidates who can represent our brand image..\n    - Looking for individuals who have native proficiency in Dutch..\n    - Must speak English without any accent.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the reviewed job posting:

<j>
Company: Bates, Lopez and Campbell

Job Title: Group Manager, Enterprise Content Management Production and Publishing

Job Summary:
We're seeking an experienced Group Manager to lead our Enterprise Content Management team in production and publishing. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in content management, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:
- Oversee the development and implementation of content management strategies
- Manage a team of content producers and publishers to ensure timely delivery of high-quality content
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure content aligns with business objectives
- Analyze content performance and provide recommendations for improvement

Qualifications:
- 5+ years of experience in content management, production, and publishing
- Proven track record of leading high-performing teams
- Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills
- Ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment

About Us:
Bates, Lopez and Campbell is a leading content management solutions provider dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experiences.

We're looking for candidates who can easily adapt to our work culture and represent our brand image. Must speak English without any accent.

</j>

<racial>The job posting discourages candidates of certain racial groups from considering applying by implying that only those who can easily adapt to the company's work culture and represent the brand image are suitable, which may exclude individuals from diverse racial backgrounds. Additionally, the requirement to speak English without an accent may unintentionally discriminate against non-native English speakers from certain racial groups.</racial></racial>"}
